page.title: 07Waddingham Village
page.content: One of the interesting features of the village is the Waddingham Green.The Green is for the general use of the public. The green would have been called the common land before enclosures and people would have used it for their animals. Often people sit on it and play games. In the middle of the green there is a huge oak tree. The tree was presented to the parish by Mr Hird and planted by Mr Kirby on behalf of Mrs Kirby to commemorate the coranation of King Edward the 7th and Queen Alexander June the 26th 1902.The green is shaped in a triangle. At one side there are some shops,at another there are the old and new schools and on the third side is a detached house. The old school is another interesting feature of the village,but it is no longer in use.
